column2: The situation in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is dire, as the drought brings people to the brink of starvation.
Unrest is growing as large areas of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] grow drier each season.
Winds from the south are bringing unusually heavy rains over most of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
The seasons have lately brought regular light rainfall over large parts of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
Reports vary from region to region: [GetWeatherSplit]
some areas run a risk of flooding, while others are enjoying lighter rain.
while the winds could still change, there are provinces where the drought has gone on too long.
some of our provinces are blessed with [GetHeavyLightRain] rains, while others suffer drought.
Some are saying I am to blame, that it is my administration and governing of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] that has failed.
If it continues this way, no one in the realm will be safe from the harsh times ahead.
We should probably keep an eye on the water levels in the region, one councilor suggests. "There are many ways to tackle this, my [Root.GetLordLady]", another interjects.
We should spend this time stockpiling for future!

I am told that the country is becoming a harsh environment for civilized people, and that people are fighting over every single drop of water. "We have some private stores in the [Root.GetCapitalHolding], of course", my council reminds me.
\n"My [Root.GetLordLady]?", my [Root.GetMyTreasurerName] [my_steward.GetTitledFirstName] interrupts my thoughts, clearly expecting me to react to the weather report.
